title: Sarong, 1900–69
medium:
Medium: silk, metallic threads
Technique: plain weave with continuous supplementary weft patterning
description: Border at each end about 30 cm (9") high with geometric flowering plants within a triangle motif ("tumpal"). Field contains an all-over floral diamond pattern. Originally a gold and silver pattern on red ground (metal no longer remaining). Two pieces sewn together with running stitch--each piece with loomed width of about 61 cm (24").

tombstone.epitaph:
Sarong, 1900–69.Medium: silk, metallic threads
Technique: plain weave with continuous supplementary weft patterning. Gift of Alan L. Wolfe. 1969-50-4.
